alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 23 at 8:53AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - At 8:00 AM, the streamgage on the Lackawaxen River near Aldenville was 6.20 feet. The flood stage is 6.5 feet. The river is expected to rise above flood stage soon. Properties along the river, including some homes along Creamton Drive and Creek Drive may be affected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aldenville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
